properties.title: Now the Cranes Fly Again
properties.description: Lecture on the impact of climate change on cranes (Biological Station Osterholz) and music including works by Isang Yun.

properties.title: Studio Sound: Walk in the Forest
properties.artist: Münchner Symphoniker, Lea Brückner (Climate Ambassador), Conductor: Joseph Bastian
properties.description: Chamber music series with forest-related works; moderated by forest experts on the future of forests.

properties.title: Festival in Achberg: Workshops, Lectures and Concerts
properties.artist: Orchester des Wandels & Guests, DJ/Ecologist Dominik Eulberg
properties.description: Over 40 participants, interactive formats on climate and nature, music in the castle garden.

properties.title: Impulse Concert: More Peatlands
properties.description: Chamber concert on the importance of peatlands for climate protection with background information.

properties.title: Recycling Concerto
properties.description: Concert for recycled percussion and orchestra in an unusual hall topology with lighting effects.

properties.title: Special Chamber Concert: Music Snacks on a Bike Tour
properties.description: Guided bike tour to Erlebnisbergwerk Velsen with musical stops and a brass ensemble.

properties.title: Music in Dialogue: Longing for Nature
properties.description: Chamber concert with a nature theme (Milhaud and others) and new texts by Jörg Hilbert.

properties.title: Discourse and Concert Performance on Climate and Environmental Issues
properties.description: Installative concert performance with live electronics and discussion format.

properties.title: Plastic Mero
properties.description: A large-scale fish sculpture made from tons of plastic waste collected in Madeira, highlighting marine pollution and the plight of the endangered Atlantic grouper ('mero'). Installed on the Funchal waterfront near the CR7 Museum.

properties.title: Seal Pup Mural
properties.description: A vibrant wall installation of a young seal, created from recycled waste materials. Raises awareness about threatened marine species and the human role in environmental degradation.

properties.title: Half Turtle Door
properties.description: Part of the 'Arte Portas Abertas' project in Funchal’s old town—a door painted with half a sea turtle, blending local heritage and ocean themes.

properties.title: Your Ancestors
properties.description: In 'Your Ancestors', Nynke Laverman invites us to think in generations instead of careers. The piece reconnects us with our ancestors and critiques modern extractivist relationships with nature. Through poetic vocals and powerful words, she builds an emotional bridge between past and future.

properties.title: Tracing Trees
properties.description: A project that traces the lifelines of trees, telling their story in the urban landscape.

properties.title: Coding into the Forest
properties.description: An interactive installation linking digital code with natural forest structures, questioning technological influence on ecosystems.

properties.title: The Forest of Brotonne
properties.description: A delicate etching depicting the ancient Forest of Brotonne in France, a reminder of the critical role forests play in carbon sequestration and biodiversity preservation.

properties.title: Solar
properties.description: A novel that satirizes climate change politics and the scientific community, centering on a Nobel-winning physicist navigating the world of renewable energy and personal failings.

properties.title: The Child in Time
properties.description: While primarily about time and loss, this novel touches on human interactions with the natural world and the social consequences of political decisions.

properties.title: Enduring Love
properties.description: A psychological drama exploring obsession and the perception of reality, subtly critiquing how humans alter their environments and interpret scientific phenomena.

properties.title: Channel #23
properties.description: A series capturing evidence of sea pollution in the mangrove forests of Malaysia, highlighting the impact of plastic waste on marine ecosystems.

properties.title: Air Pollution of Iran
properties.description: A work featuring faded Iranian flags, stained by the air pollution in Tehran, drawing parallels between environmental degradation and political struggles.

properties.title: The Eye in the Sky
properties.description: A collaborative piece between photographer Gauri Gill and indigenous artist Rajesh Vangad, incorporating traditional iconography into a landscape photograph.

properties.title: Six Sculptures
properties.description: Over a year, sculptor Bruce McLean made these six sculptures from natural materials near his home in Barnes, South West London, reflecting on time and nature cycles.

properties.title: Big Yellow Taxi
properties.description: A song by Joni Mitchell highlighting the consequences of urban development and deforestation.

properties.title: Der traurige Gärtner
properties.description: A song criticizing the impact of oil corporations on the environment.

properties.title: Bauer Karl und die Spanische Gurke
properties.description: A short story by Hans Cronau discussing the impact of economic structures on food production and labor conditions.

properties.title: New Trajectory
properties.description: A striking painting by Chhoeun Channy using vibrant colors to depict a giant monkey sitting on a green leaf, symbolizing humanity’s obliviousness to environmental destruction. A van followed by trucks cuts through a canyon, with Earth appearing among the stars.

properties.title: Oxygen
properties.description: A painting by Van Chhovorn blending Cambodian tradition with nature. A figure inspired by classical Cambodian art is shown nurturing a plant, reinforcing the connection between heritage and the environment.

properties.title: 100 Years of Friendship
properties.description: A relief sculpture on canvas by Sou Sophy featuring two hornbills passing fruit to each other, symbolizing love, cooperation, and the importance of preserving wildlife.

properties.title: 7 Days of Garbage
properties.description: A photographic project where individuals and families pose with a week's worth of their garbage to highlight waste consumption.

properties.title: Nausicaä of the Valley of the Wind
properties.description: A post-apocalyptic anime film exploring themes of environmental destruction, toxic landscapes, and the relationship between humans and nature.

properties.title: Princess Mononoke
properties.description: A powerful film depicting the conflict between industrial expansion and the spirits of the forest, highlighting themes of deforestation, exploitation, and ecological balance.

properties.title: Ponyo
properties.description: A heartwarming animated film about a magical fish girl, highlighting themes of ocean pollution, marine conservation, and the balance of nature.

properties.title: Illustrations on Sustainability
properties.description: Susanne Krauss creates expressive illustrations addressing complex societal and environmental issues. Her work ranges from journalistic illustrations to sustainability-focused visual storytelling.

properties.title: The New York Earth Room
properties.description: An installation by Walter De Maria highlighting the relationship between humans and the environment.

properties.title: Giant Plastic Tap
properties.description: A 30-foot art installation depicting a giant faucet spewing plastic waste, symbolizing the continuous flow of plastic pollution into our environment.

properties.title: The Water Table
properties.description: Interactive installation highlighting the vulnerability of freshwater resources.

properties.title: The Gates
properties.description: A temporary installation by Christo and Jeanne-Claude consisting of 7,503 gates with free-flowing fabric hanging down.

properties.title: River of Plastic
properties.description: An impactful installation by Monika Lin highlighting the prevalence of plastic pollution in rivers and its environmental consequences.

properties.title: The Weather Project
properties.description: An installation by Olafur Eliasson, creating a giant artificial sun in the Tate Modern's Turbine Hall, which explores human perceptions of weather and climate change.

properties.title: Breathe with Me
properties.description: An interactive installation by Jeppe Hein, part of ART2030, that encourages public engagement with the themes of mindfulness, air quality, and environmental responsibility.

properties.title: Plastic Ocean
properties.description: An immersive installation highlighting the pervasive issue of plastic pollution in our oceans. Visitors are enveloped in a sea of plastic waste to reflect on human consumption and environmental impact.

properties.title: Aquatic Fauna No. 1
properties.description: A mural featuring paper-cut depictions of various animals and plants, emphasizing conservation in an urban transit environment.
properties.artist: Lam Hoi Lit and Chua Chye Teck

properties.title: What is a Tree?
properties.description: A mural depicting the iconic Tembusu tree with quotes about trees, encouraging reflection on the importance of nature in urban settings.

properties.title: Bleached Coral
properties.description: An installation addressing coral bleaching.

properties.title: Islands of Waste
properties.description: Installation representing the Pacific Garbage Patch.

properties.title: Desert Bloom
properties.description: An art piece addressing water scarcity in the desert.

properties.title: Climate Wall
properties.description: A digital wall showcasing the carbon impact of daily activities.

properties.title: Ocean Echo
properties.description: Installation mimicking ocean sounds to raise awareness of ocean pollution.

properties.title: The Last Breath
properties.description: Installation addressing air quality in urban areas.

properties.title: Aurora Aksnes and Jacob Collier - The Seed
properties.description: The Norwegian singer Aurora released a song 'The Seed' addressing humanity's greed: 'When the last tree has fallen, and the rivers are poisoned, you cannot eat money, oh no.' She actively supports environmental movements and human rights, including an Arctic concert in collaboration with Jacob Collier to protect the seas and the climate.

properties.title: Bordalo II - Trash Art
properties.description: The Portuguese activist artist Artur Bordalo, known as Bordalo II, creates large-scale installations and murals from plastic waste and found objects. His sculptures aim to highlight the waste and overconsumption in today's world.

properties.title: Christi Belcourt - Indigenous Nature
properties.description: Canadian Métis artist Christi Belcourt’s works explore the indigenous connection to nature, biodiversity, and environmental protection. Her paintings, inspired by traditional beadwork, portray detailed representations of ecosystems and natural elements.

properties.title: Nnenna Okore - Eco Sculptures
properties.description: Okore uses plant-based materials and food waste to create large-scale sculptures and installations addressing waste, carbon emissions, and energy use. She transforms materials into bioplastic to craft eco-artworks.

properties.title: Eko Nugroho - Urban Ecology
properties.description: Indonesian artist Eko Nugroho focuses on the impacts of urbanization and consumerism on the environment. His works often highlight resource destruction and the loss of nature through urban expansion, while advocating for sustainable futures.

properties.title: Underwater Museum of Art
properties.description: An underwater sculpture museum addressing coral reef restoration.

properties.title: Vertical Garden of São Paulo
properties.description: A green wall installation addressing air pollution in urban areas.

properties.title: Nile's Legacy
properties.description: Sculpture using river debris to symbolize the Nile’s challenges.

properties.title: Ana Teresa Barboza - Between Air and Sea
properties.description: Using traditional techniques, native plants, and local collaborations, Ana Teresa Barboza creates monumental tapestries.

properties.title: River of Life
properties.description: An installation addressing water pollution in the Yamuna River.

properties.title: Bleached Reef
properties.description: Art installation addressing coral bleaching in the Great Barrier Reef.

properties.title: River Revival
properties.description: An art project using debris to highlight water scarcity issues.

properties.title: Treehotel - Mirrorcube
properties.description: A camouflaged treehouse installation promoting sustainable tourism.

properties.title: Forest Revival
properties.description: Interactive installations showcasing reforestation efforts.

properties.title: Museo de la Basura
properties.description: Environmental art project led by Alejandro Durán that aims to transform the international waste washing up along the coast of Sian Ka’an in Mexico into art and awareness.

properties.title: Eco-Walls of Buenos Aires
properties.description: Murals created from recycled materials.

properties.title: Andean Streams
properties.description: Sculptures addressing water issues in Medellin.

properties.title: Carbon Towers
properties.description: A digital exhibition on the impact of carbon footprints.

properties.title: Water Cycle Symphony
properties.description: An interactive sound installation about the water cycle.

properties.title: Dead Sea Revival
properties.description: Sculptures highlighting water loss in the Dead Sea.

properties.title: Green Delhi
properties.description: Vertical gardens in urban spaces.

properties.title: Ocean Mirror
properties.description: Interactive art emphasizing ocean pollution.

properties.title: Sand Dunes of Cairo
properties.description: An installation on the fragility of desert ecosystems.

properties.title: Palus Flores
properties.description: A project combining flower sculptures and soil samples to highlight human-induced changes to urban nature.

properties.title: Vaga
properties.description: An exhibition reflecting on environmental and cultural themes of the Russian village.
properties.location: Moscow Museum of Modern Art, Russia

properties.title: Psychozoic Era
properties.description: A project examining industrial waste and landfill issues through paintings and films.

properties.title: The Lost Planet
properties.description: A mixed-media series addressing global environmental concerns like climate change and pollution.

properties.title: Floridas
properties.description: A photographic series capturing environmentalism and political scenarios, originally exhibited in The Met.

properties.title: Baltic Sea Rescue Project
properties.description: A public art installation addressing marine pollution in the Baltic Sea.

properties.title: Green Futures
properties.description: A sculpture showcasing renewable energy innovation.

properties.title: Yangtze River Plastic Wave
properties.description: A giant sculpture made from plastic collected along the Yangtze River.

properties.title: Smog Tower Art
properties.description: An innovative smog-absorbing tower doubling as an art installation.

properties.title: Wildlife Corridors
properties.description: An initiative using art installations to promote animal migration corridors.

properties.title: Kinshasa Green Mural
properties.description: A mural promoting urban reforestation.
properties.location: Kinshasa, Democratic Republic of the Congo

properties.title: The Karoo Energy Project
properties.description: An art project exploring renewable energy potential in semi-arid regions.

properties.title: Cape Coral Crisis
properties.description: A coral-shaped sculpture highlighting ocean acidification effects.

properties.title: Washed up
properties.description: Alejandro Durán's 'Washed Up' series uses plastic debris to create vibrant, thought-provoking installations on the shores of Sian Ka'an, Mexico.

properties.title: Gyrecraft
properties.description: Studio Swine's project transforming ocean plastic waste into exquisite objects using a solar-powered machine aboard a sailing boat.

properties.title: Plastic Reef
properties.description: A sculpture created from plastic waste collected from oceans worldwide, resembling a coral reef.

properties.title: The Great Plastic Garbage Patch
properties.description: 'Drifters Project' addresses ocean plastic pollution through installations made from debris collected on beaches.

properties.title: Plastic Bag Jellyfish
properties.description: Delicate sculptures crafted from recycled plastic bottles, resembling ethereal jellyfish.

properties.title: Plastic Bottle Village
properties.description: An eco-friendly community in Panama, constructing homes using recycled plastic bottles.

properties.title: Washed Ashore Project
properties.description: A non-profit organization led by Angela Haseltine Pozzi that creates large-scale sculptures from marine debris to educate about ocean pollution.

properties.title: Vampire Conspiracy
properties.description: A satirical and thought-provoking song that draws a parallel between capitalism and vampirism, highlighting how corporations extract wealth and resources in a way that mirrors the behavior of vampires. The song critiques economic exploitation and climate inaction with dark humor and catchy melodies.

properties.title: Greetings from the Danube Bend!
properties.description: A graphic image in which a skull drifts down the river around Nagymaros. The Inconnu groups’ focus on environmental issues was deeply related to their critique of the state-socialist regime.

properties.title: Spiral Jetty
properties.description: A monumental earthwork forming a spiral-shaped pier made of basalt rocks and soil in the Great Salt Lake, Utah. The artwork explores the relationship between nature, time, and environmental changes.

properties.title: Touch Sanitation
properties.description: A performance art project in which the artist shook hands with over 8,500 New York City sanitation workers, acknowledging their role in environmental maintenance and waste management.

properties.title: The Drying Sea
properties.description: A series of salt crystal sculptures in the Dead Sea, highlighting the ecological crisis and water scarcity in the region.

properties.title: Breathe
properties.description: A light installation that changes color based on air pollution levels, making CO2 concentrations visible and raising awareness of environmental impact.

properties.title: Baltic Trash Waves
properties.description: A floating art installation made from plastic waste collected from the Baltic Sea, drawing attention to the issue of marine pollution.

properties.title: Tokyo’s Smog Dome
properties.description: An interactive digital projection mapping Tokyo’s air quality over a year, visualizing the hidden impact of pollution.

properties.title: Exhibition: Climate Change
properties.description: ´Science-fiction installations that imagines a future sculpted by ruinous climate crisis and the ordinary people destined to inhabit it´. (MOCA)

properties.title: The Plastic Whale
properties.description: A giant sculpture made entirely from plastic waste collected from the ocean, emphasizing the impact of pollution on marine life.

properties.title: Carbon Emissions Clock
properties.description: A real-time display showing global carbon emissions, raising awareness about the urgency of climate action.

properties.title: Amazonian Warning
properties.description: A large-scale mural depicting the destruction of the Amazon rainforest, calling for action against deforestation.

properties.title: The Smog Tower
properties.description: A giant air-purifying tower that doubles as a public art installation, tackling air pollution in urban spaces.
